snippet: The Supreme Court seems to believe that there is no reason to rush to make same-sex marriage the law of the land in all 50 states. But why?
abstract: Editorial welcomes Supreme Court's decision not to hear any of seven state petitions asking them to reject a constitutional right to same-sex marriage; notes decision means thirty states and the District of Columbia could soon allow such marriages, covering some 60 percent of all Americans; contends it has been astonishing and moving to see the unprecedented speed with which the public and judiciary have come around.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court seems to believe that there is no reason to rush to make same-sex marriage the law of the land in all 50 states. But why?

headline.main: One Step Closer to Marriage Equality
headline.print_headline: One Step Closer to Marriage Equality

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
